cultural_note: Lisbon and Porto are Portugal's two main 'cidades' - rivalry is friendly!
example2_en: I live in a big city.

mnemonic: RUA = HOO-a - the R sounds like H in Portuguese!
cultural_note: Portuguese streets often named after dates: 'Rua 25 de Abril'!

mnemonic: CASA = KA-za - your CASA is your home!
grammar_notes: Can mean house or home. 'Em casa' = at home.
cultural_note: 'Mi casa es su casa' works in Portuguese too - 'A minha casa é a sua casa'!

mnemonic: LOJA = LO-ja - think LODGE where you shop!
cultural_note: Portuguese 'lojas' often close for lunch - check hours!
'Pingo Doce' and 'Continente' are main Portuguese supermarket chains!
Portuguese restaurants serve big portions - 'meia dose' (half portion) is option!

mnemonic: HOSPITAL = os-pi-TAL - same as English but H is silent!
cultural_note: Portuguese healthcare is good - public system 'SNS' covers everyone!
distractors: a farmácia;o centro de saúde;a clínica

cultural_note: Portuguese pharmacies are great - pharmacists give medical advice!
tip: Common on every street in Portugal

grammar_notes: Feminine. Train or bus station. Nasal 'ão'.
cultural_note: 'Estação de Santa Apolónia' is Lisbon's main international station!
Lisbon airport 'Humberto Delgado' is close to city center - convenient!

mnemonic: PRAIA = PRY-a - cry 'PRAIA!' at the beach!
grammar_notes: Feminine noun. Portugal has beautiful beaches.
cultural_note: Portugal's coastline: Algarve beaches in south surf beaches in north!
Portuguese churches are stunning - 'Igreja dos Clérigos' in Porto is iconic!
